oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Medal and neck ribbon for Gold Star Pilgrimage
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A circular bronze medal with the obverse design featuring a passenger ship flanked by the Statue of Liberty on the left and the Eiffel Tower on the right, a large five pointed star overhead and "1933." below. The reverse bears "GOLD STAR/PILGRIMAGE/ TO THE/BATTLEFIELDS/OF/THE WORLD WAR." The medal is attached to a blue, white and red silk neck ribbon and belonged to Sarah Frances Ring of Franklin, Tenn. Her son, Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div., was killed in action in Oct. 1918.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
